intro: Anomalotis quinqueseta, commonly known as the five-leaved broomrape, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host plants for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of grasses and other herbaceous species. The plant has a slender, yellowish stem with five pairs of small, scale-like leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its parasitic nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species in certain regions.
